page.title: 09Hunter_Gatherer Man_Eartham.
page.content: When the men were taking out the gravel from Eartham Quarry they discovered evidence of very early man there. The evidence which the archeologists have so far found has consisted of a Stone Age camp, with remains of a cooking fire, small animal bones and flint tools.There does not appear to be any human bones, so perhaps this tribe moved on. Very close to this camp, the archeologists have also discovered evidence of the oldest beach in Britain, with layers of stone,sand, silt,chalk and flint. Perhaps Stone Age Man built his camp on the beach, stayed for a while then moved on to a new site when the supply of food ran short, or were chased off by another tribe.
